PokerProject

Class Simulation

  • Object
    • Game
      • Simulation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VideoPoker

    public class Simulation
extends Game
    Class Simulation extends Class Game and it represents the Simulation Mode of playing Video Poker.

    When running in this mode, the game is automatically played with a perfect strategy in order to understand the average gain in the player's credit.

    This class has one more attribute besides the ones from its superclass:

    • totalNbDeals - final Integer that consists of the total number of deals.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class Game

        data, deck, tableDB, user

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Simulation(int initMoney, int betVal, int dealsValue, Variants optionTable)
      Constructor specifying the initial balance of the player, the value to bet during all simulation, the total number of deals and the Variants of Video Poker being used.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doDeal()
      Dealing the cards (in Simulation Mode) means that five cards from the deck are assigned as the user's first hand and that the bet value is decremented from the player's credit.
      void doEvaluation()
      The evaluation of the final hand (in Simulation Mode) consists of checking the result (win or lost), incrementing the number of deals (in the statistics), incrementing the incNbHands accordingly and incrementing the credits won in case of winning hand.
      void doHold()
      Holding cards (in Simulation Mode) means that the perfect strategy is used as the choice for which cards to hold.
      void doStatistics()
      The statistics (in Simulation Mode) are asked only at the end of the game, and then a table with the statistics is printed in the terminal.
      void play()
      Play the game in Simulation Mode.

      • Methods inherited from class Game

        doAdvice, doBet, doCredit, getBetValue, setBetValue

      • Methods inherited from class Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulation

        public Simulation(int initMoney,
                  int betVal,
                  int dealsValue,
                  Variants optionTable)
        Constructor specifying the initial balance of the player, the value to bet during all simulation, the total number of deals and the Variants of Video Poker being used. Some of these attributes are the same used to construct the superclass Game.
        Parameters:
        initMoney - initial balance of the player when starting the game.
        betVal - value to bet during all simulation.
        dealsValue - total number of deals.
        optionTable - variant of Video Poker used in the game.

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public void play()
          throws IOException
        Play the game in Simulation Mode. The game is automatically played totalNbDeals times, betting always the specified betValue. In each move, a new shuffled deck is created, cards are dealt, the perfect strategy is used for deciding which cards to hold and the evaluation of the final hand is accomplished. At the end of all the deals, the table with the statistics of the game is printed in the terminal.
        Specified by:
        play in interface VideoPoker
        Specified by:
        play in class Game
        Throws:
        IOException - Exception not needed but included since it implements the abstract method from Game.

      • doStatistics

        public void doStatistics()
        The statistics (in Simulation Mode) are asked only at the end of the game, and then a table with the statistics is printed in the terminal. This method is an override of the method implemented in Game.
        Specified by:
        doStatistics in interface VideoPoker
        Overrides:
        doStatistics in class Game

      • doDeal

        public void doDeal()
        Dealing the cards (in Simulation Mode) means that five cards from the deck are assigned as the user's first hand and that the bet value is decremented from the player's credit.

      • doHold

        public void doHold()
        Holding cards (in Simulation Mode) means that the perfect strategy is used as the choice for which cards to hold. After holding, the evaluation of the final hand is done in order to verify if it is a winning hand or a lost one. This method is an override of the method implemented in Game.
        Specified by:
        doHold in interface VideoPoker
        Overrides:
        doHold in class Game

      • doEvaluation

        public void doEvaluation()
        The evaluation of the final hand (in Simulation Mode) consists of checking the result (win or lost), incrementing the number of deals (in the statistics), incrementing the incNbHands accordingly and incrementing the credits won in case of winning hand. This method is an override of the method implemented in Game.
        Specified by:
        doEvaluation in interface VideoPoker
        Overrides:
        doEvaluation in class Game
